p: The results of behavioral testing (immobility during forced swimming test) are shown in figure 1. Compared with the control group, treatment with reserpine significantly increased the immobility time during the forced swimming test (P=0.02). Prescription of 50 and 100 mg/kg Marze essential oil as well as fluoxetine significantly ameliorated the reserpine-induced incremental changes in the immobility time during the forced swim (P=0.04, P=0.03, P=0.04, respectively).
